intro: Eriogonum pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its stems are usually hairy as well. Eriogonum pauciflorum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is considered a valuable plant for ecological restoration projects.
